skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
With precise applications of unmaking, any threat may be rendered null and void in turn.
Masters of the very laws of nature, Archmages hold dominion of the mind and the immaterial, bending it to their will.

effects.description: adds the ability that grants the spell intensity

skillTree.localised_description: A wise wizard always maintains a barrier around himself, warding off magical attacks with ease.

effects.description: Duration +60% for Lifebloom and Shield of Saphery

skillTree.localised_description: A thick mist appears to envelop the army, visible only to the enemy, leaving Hothar’s troops with a clear view.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: One of wonders in his collection, this celestial shard is a powerfull conduit of fire wind.
Hothar is not above teaching his incredible techniques to those willing to learn, and to endure his overly long explanations.

effects.description:
Experience per turn: +300 for Archmages, Mages and Loremasters of Hoeth
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Built atop an island of pink stone, Hothar’s mobile castle is a jarring sight to the unsuspecting.

effects.description:
Army Ability "Summon Hothar's Flying Castle"
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Hothar's Flying Castle will disengage after a short period

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Apotheosis Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Archmage destroys their enemies from within, corroding their minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A host of spectral warriors created from raw magical energy—a mere illusion to confuse the enemy.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of the Glittering Host
Summons a unit of the Glittering Host

skillTree.localised_description: Brilliant flames leap from casters outstretched hands, incinerating everything they touch.

effects.description: Miscast chance for "Flames of Hoeth Upgraded" -15%

skillTree.localised_description: The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: A swirling tornado of mist and water vapours created by contrary wind currents blowing through hot air. Whirling at great speed, it flings buildings and overturns the heaviest war machines.
A beam of shining light flies across the sky, easy to mistake for a shooting star… until it hits you.

The Uleishi are strange magical creatures, their thin-limbed bodies appearing as glowing lights dancing to an unheard tune, weaving in and out of crops as their footsteps leave behind fresh sprouts of corn. These beings are believed to be created by the great magical energy that shaped the White Tower of Hoeth, as they are only found in Saphery. Hothar enlists these creatures to tend to his crops, ensuring that the harvest is bountiful.
Only a select few can master the ability to manipulate objects through sheer force of will.

effects.description: Enables "Dazed" contact effect (reduced Speed and Melee Defence)

skillTree.localised_description: Lileath is the patron of prophecies and beauty, strongly associated with innocence and forgiveness. Only the true of heart are granted her blessing, for she judges not the deeds but the heart’s desire.

ui_effects.localised_text: Intensity reduces from enemy winds spent

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Such is this wizard’s mastery of magic that the Winds may be channeled, undaunted by surrounding chaos, to perform feats thought impossible amongst lesser races.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +3 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +7% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Years of experience in mounted combat has started to pay off; this one is always in command of both their force and its steeds.

effects.description:
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +7% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Ellyrian Reavers units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Ellyrian Reavers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The air around archmage is thick with enchantments tha befuddle and confound the foe.
Being present at the very forefront of the assault, on many occasions, prepares one for future engagements of a similar nature.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +9% for Tiranoc Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Tiranoc Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The firmament holds no fear for this one, such is their command of the many airborne beasts of battle.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +3 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +3 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A simple but effective spell that ensures arrows hit their mark.

effects.description: Enables passive ability "Curse of Arrow Attraction"

skillTree.localised_description: Saphery is an enchanted land, with skies that shine with all the colours of the rainbow, hills that move by night and warm rivers that glow with gentle light.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: -10% for enemy armies starting their turn in this region
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +8%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +16%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +24%

skillTree.localised_description: Visions cloud the mind, prophesising the arrival of the enemy and uncovering every shadow in which they lurk.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: Masters of magic are often sought out by younger mages in the hopes of becoming skilled themselves under the wizard's expert tutelage.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Mages
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
“Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.”
All Asur adore the Everqueen, but Alarielle is especially beloved for her willingness to join warriors in battle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

items.colour_text: Robes made of the finest silk and gaudy accoutrements, perfectly befitting the status that Hothar holds.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: A powerful weapon that can drain the magic from an enemy and redirect it to the wielder, augmenting him with even greater strength.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +12

Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Like most Elves of Saphery, magic strongly courses through Hothar’s blood. Fully convinced of his grandeur, he lives far above the clouds in his floating estate, literally looking down upon the common folk.

effects.description: Hothar's army has access to unique action mechanic known as "Castle Rites"

Army Ability "Summon Hothar's Flying Castle" on friendly territory
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This character has arcane conduit innately.

effects.description:
Enables Tunnelling stance for army
	(Lord's army)
